info.headline: Hard Freeze Warning issued January 15 at 7:11PM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...HARD FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST TUESDAY... ...HARD FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 25. For the Hard Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 21 expected. For the Hard Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 18 possible. * WHERE...Inland Refugio and Inland Calhoun Counties. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, until midnight CST tonight. For the Hard Freeze Warning, from midnight tonight to noon CST Tuesday. For the Hard Freeze Watch, from Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
